abstract: Are Diwali celebrations incomplete without firecrackers.
snippet: Are Diwali celebrations incomplete without firecrackers.
lead_paragraph: For most people, Diwali festivities are incomplete without the crackling of firecrackers. And almost everyone has a favorite, ranging from the innocuous "phooljhadi," or sparkler, to the rocket, which usually fails to live up to its name, hissing into the sky with fierce intensity only to fall flat on the ground within minutes. And then there is the pernicious-sounding "bomb," whose name says it all. They come in different shapes and sizes but the firecrackers have one thing in common: they unleash an ear-splitting bang when they are set ablaze.
